segment.source: Adding Wi-Fi manufacturing test support to the OID interface
segment.target: Adding Wi-Fi manufacturing test support to the OID interface

segment.source: Adding Wi-Fi manufacturing test support to the OID interface
segment.target: Adding Wi-Fi manufacturing test support to the OID interface

segment.source: Adding Wi-Fi manufacturing test support to the OID interface
segment.target: Adding Wi-Fi manufacturing test support to the OID interface

segment.source: To ensure that all device components are integrated, functioning correctly, calibrated properly, and meet all regulatory requirements, OEMs run a number of standard ad-hoc tests to ensure that any problems are found and corrected before the device goes to retail.
segment.target: To ensure that all device components are integrated, functioning correctly, calibrated properly, and meet all regulatory requirements, OEMs run a number of standard ad-hoc tests to ensure that any problems are found and corrected before the device goes to retail.

segment.source: These tests are also occasionally run at retail outlets to check for proper component operation.
segment.target: These tests are also occasionally run at retail outlets to check for proper component operation.

segment.source: The implementation of these test interfaces and mechanisms is performed by hardware vendors (IHVs).
segment.target: The implementation of these test interfaces and mechanisms is performed by hardware vendors (IHVs).

segment.source: This section describes an extension to the existing Wi-Fi OID documentation so that IHVs can implement a standard set of interfaces that OEMs can use to create test applications.
segment.target: This section describes an extension to the existing Wi-Fi OID documentation so that IHVs can implement a standard set of interfaces that OEMs can use to create test applications.

segment.source: Assumptions
segment.target: Assumptions

segment.source: To perform these manufacturing tests, the device must be operating in a special operation mode called manufacturing mode.
segment.target: To perform these manufacturing tests, the device must be operating in a special operation mode called manufacturing mode.

segment.source: In manufacturing mode, only specific parts of the operating system are loaded in order to enable the proper execution of the component tests.
segment.target: In manufacturing mode, only specific parts of the operating system are loaded in order to enable the proper execution of the component tests.

segment.source: Normal Wi-Fi operations, such as scanning and automatically connecting to networks, are disabled when the device is running in manufacturing mode.
segment.target: Normal Wi-Fi operations, such as scanning and automatically connecting to networks, are disabled when the device is running in manufacturing mode.

segment.source: Manufacturing mode can be entered in the manufacturing environment or during customer service.
segment.target: Manufacturing mode can be entered in the manufacturing environment or during customer service.

segment.source: Writing to the Device Provisioning Partition (DPP) can only be performed in the manufacturing environment.
segment.target: Writing to the Device Provisioning Partition (DPP) can only be performed in the manufacturing environment.

segment.source: If an OID that writes to the DPP is invoked in a non-manufacturing environment, the attempt to write to the DPP fails.
segment.target: If an OID that writes to the DPP is invoked in a non-manufacturing environment, the attempt to write to the DPP fails.

segment.source: Manufacturing operations should have only a transient effect on the system, and the state should not persist across reboots.
segment.target: Manufacturing operations should have only a transient effect on the system, and the state should not persist across reboots.

segment.source: Driver requirements
segment.target: Driver requirements

segment.source: The Wi-Fi miniport driver must be able to operate in normal mode or manufacturing test mode, and it must be able to switch between modes at any time.
segment.target: The Wi-Fi miniport driver must be able to operate in normal mode or manufacturing test mode, and it must be able to switch between modes at any time.

segment.source: The driver determines the appropriate mode during initialization by querying a specific registry key.
segment.target: The driver determines the appropriate mode during initialization by querying a specific registry key.

segment.source: The following illustration shows the architecture of the manufacturing test environment.
segment.target: The following illustration shows the architecture of the manufacturing test environment.

segment.source: mte design
segment.target: mte design
